intro: Rubus holzfuszii, commonly known as the Holzfuszi blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
